channel.title: What cellphone do you own?
channel.description:
I own the IPhone 4
[img]http://www.digitaltrends.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/iphone-4-facetime.jpg[/img]
Didn't come with the asian on it though.

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Blackberry Curve 9300, my old blackberry died on me and I had just spent £600 so I was really broke and this 9300 was only £120 at the time. Only decent BB I could afford at the time. I’m a bbm kinda guy, bbs suck in general(exluding the 9360 curve and the bb bold 9900 although it isn’t worth it for the price).

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Nerice, post:185, topic:369953”]Have not owned a cell phone since the late 90’s. I do know how to fix and design them (EET) lol.

Pretty funny fact. My employer gives almost everyone a company phone, we cannot bring them into the office. Having one past the second security guard station is grounds for immediate termination, have to leave them in the mantrap area. They want to make sure no pictures are taken.[/quote]
what do you do/where do you work?

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

My Phone has 6 pounds on it. You know what they say the bigger the better

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Have not owned a cell phone since the late 90’s. I do know how to fix and design them (EET) lol.

Pretty funny fact. My employer gives almost everyone a company phone, we cannot bring them into the office. Having one past the second security guard station is grounds for immediate termination, have to leave them in the mantrap area. They want to make sure no pictures are taken.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:183, topic:369953”][quote author=Rix_ link=topic=466071.msg3941519#msg3941519 date=1331438130]

Actually, I take this back, that ROM I was using was actually pretty unstable and it force closed a lot of my apps, mainly games.

I’m now using Android Revolution 6.2.x, it’s the ICS 4.0.3 and Sense 3.6 one, but I removed sense completely, reskinned everything and it now looks exactly like a vanilla android build, I had no idea it was possible to skin it that much to make it look completely different, also is extremely smooth, not in the pictures but it uses the ICS lockscreen too, not sense.

Using go launcher (I have the actual trebuchet android ics launcher but I prefer the look of this):

[img]https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-sQ2ymU2X-M8/TzffI4x6TGI/AAAAAAAAADY/71CFx2Nih7Q/s512/2012-02-12_15-43-07.png[/ img]

[img]https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-LCtc3XlPx6o/TzfftO-A0GI/AAAAAAAAADg/Gbc-dRXyX4M/s512/2012-02-12_15-49-29.png[/ img]

That looks great. Have you tried the Virtuous Inquisition ROM?

Anyways, I just checked a few weeks ago that the telcos here only have the HTC Sensation phone for sale without contract. There’s no way I will pay $400+ for it.
[/quote]

I’m sure you can get a used one for half that or less, no use buying a new phone.[/quote]Add that to the fact that you’ll end up paying more hard cash for a contract anyway, it’s just stretched out.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’m now using Android Revolution 6.2.x, it’s the ICS 4.0.3 and Sense 3.6 one, but I removed sense completely, reskinned everything and it now looks exactly like a vanilla android build, I had no idea it was possible to skin it that much to make it look completely different, also is extremely smooth, not in the pictures but it uses the ICS lockscreen too, not sense.

[/quote]

That looks great. Have you tried the Virtuous Inquisition ROM?

Anyways, I just checked a few weeks ago that the telcos here only have the HTC Sensation phone for sale without contract. There’s no way I will pay $400+ for it.[/quote]

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

i would highly advise against the evo 3d, having repaired 9999 of them i can tell you that many of them are of questionable build quality
unless of course your gsm versions across the pond (i don’t think uk carriers are cdma but i could be wrong) are significantly different, in which case i can’t speak for them

Read full topic

hilarious

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @Skyru Skyru
item.description:
@Skyru wrote:

I got this for my birthday about a month ago.

I get reception wherever I go, she even put me on the family plan.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:178, topic:369953”]That looks great. Have you tried the Virtuous Inquisition ROM?

Anyways, I just checked a few weeks ago that the telcos here only have the HTC Sensation phone for sale without contract. There’s no way I will pay $400+ for it.[/quote]
I haven’t no, I had the virtuous quattro for a while, but I think that’s been discontinued as it hadn’t been updated for around 2 months, but I’ve heard good things

Have you looked at the Evo 3D? Here in UK it’s going for around £200 unlocked at Asda, which is fantastic considering it started at £500, has same specs as the Sensation, only it has 256mb more RAM, and a slightly lower megapixel camera. It’s a good phone, I think it just didn’t sell too well due to the 3D being a bit gimmicky.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:176, topic:369953”]Actually, I take this back, that ROM I was using was actually pretty unstable and it force closed a lot of my apps, mainly games.

I’m now using Android Revolution 6.2.x, it’s the ICS 4.0.3 and Sense 3.6 one, but I removed sense completely, reskinned everything and it now looks exactly like a vanilla android build, I had no idea it was possible to skin it that much to make it look completely different, also is extremely smooth, not in the pictures but it uses the ICS lockscreen too, not sense.

Using go launcher (I have the actual trebuchet android ics launcher but I prefer the look of this):

[img]https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-sQ2ymU2X-M8/TzffI4x6TGI/AAAAAAAAADY/71CFx2Nih7Q/s512/2012-02-12_15-43-07.png[/ img]

[img]https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-LCtc3XlPx6o/TzfftO-A0GI/AAAAAAAAADg/Gbc-dRXyX4M/s512/2012-02-12_15-49-29.png[/ img][/quote]

That looks great. Have you tried the Virtuous Inquisition ROM?

Anyways, I just checked a few weeks ago that the telcos here only have the HTC Sensation phone for sale without contract. There’s no way I will pay $400+ for it.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:176, topic:369953”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=466071.msg3910825#msg3910825 date=1328722832]

I’m thinking of getting a HTC Sensation (probably free with my data plan) so I can flash this ROM. Are there any other HTC phones I should consider getting?

I’ve got the Sensation XE, depends where you are, in UK it’s still the highest spec HTC, but in US I think the Rezound is slightly better, whether the price is justified I don’t know, but with quad core phones just weeks away it’s always changing.

@ the custom rom, why stick with sense? I’m currently running a vanilla android 4.0.3 ROM and it’s ten times smoother and prettier.

XDA Developers

[21 JAN][ROM/WIP][AOSP] Virtuous Quattro Alpha3 4.0.3 [Kernel HTC 3.0.16]

Welcome to Virtuous Quattro. This is a pretty much a pure AOSP build of Android 4.0.3 Ice Cream Sandwich with tweaks and optimization's by the Virtuous T…


[/quote]
Actually, I take this back, that ROM I was using was actually pretty unstable and it force closed a lot of my apps, mainly games.

I’m now using Android Revolution 6.2.x, it’s the ICS 4.0.3 and Sense 3.6 one, but I removed sense completely, reskinned everything and it now looks exactly like a vanilla android build, I had no idea it was possible to skin it that much to make it look completely different, also is extremely smooth, not in the pictures but it uses the ICS lockscreen too, not sense.

Using go launcher (I have the actual trebuchet android ics launcher but I prefer the look of this):

[/quote]
naice

Read full topic

Using go launcher (I have the actual trebuchet android ics launcher but I prefer the look of this):

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I can definitely confirm that there are still a multitude of problems with htc sense. Mostly they cause the phone to shut off and restart a couple times before it fixes itsself for an extended period of time. But it never fixes permanantly…

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I decided to wait on upgrading, so I borrowed an EVO 4G from work . Loaded ics-deck-evo on it, and it runs like a dream!

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:173, topic:369953”][quote author=Rix_ link=topic=466071.msg3910695#msg3910695 date=1328700980]
I’m thinking of getting a HTC Sensation (probably free with my data plan) so I can flash this ROM. Are there any other HTC phones I should consider getting?
[/quote]
I’ve got the Sensation XE, depends where you are, in UK it’s still the highest spec HTC, but in US I think the Rezound is slightly better, whether the price is justified I don’t know, but with quad core phones just weeks away it’s always changing.

@ the custom rom, why stick with sense? I’m currently running a vanilla android 4.0.3 ROM and it’s ten times smoother and prettier.

XDA Developers

[21 JAN][ROM/WIP][AOSP] Virtuous Quattro Alpha3 4.0.3 [Kernel HTC 3.0.16]

Welcome to Virtuous Quattro. This is a pretty much a pure AOSP build of Android 4.0.3 Ice Cream Sandwich with tweaks and optimization's by the Virtuous T…


This. I get a ton of people complaining about sense/htc apps slowing down their phones/not working right

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:169, topic:369953”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=466071.msg3906285#msg3906285 date=1328246841]

droid 4 is coming out soon, basically a droid razr with a physical keyboard - rumor is feb 9 release, here’s a review http://www.digitaltrends.com/mobile/motorola-droid-4-impressions-finally-a-4g-lte-phone-with-a-decent-keyboard/

I’ve seen the razr in person, and I wouldn’t remotely want that either, the screen is so friggin big it wouldn’t even fit in my pocket, damn…

I can pick up a Droid 3 from ebay for about 335 usd including shipping to Sweden, which is a pretty damn low price (borked ESN, aka won’t work on US providers, but fine on others). I probably will within the next 2-3 months or so, as i really want a physical keyboard over the turd that is touch-keyboard.

I can buy one locally for around $200-$250, but without solid cyanogenmod support I’m not sure.

@Swype, yes I have it, not as good as a physical keyboard.
[/quote]Oh wow, that sounds even better! Would it be possible for you to nab one for me? I can pay in advance over a bank transfer, including shipping of course!

I wouldn’t be against it, I just don’t know how much it would cost me to ship something from here to where you live, it’s possible it might not be worth it. PM me your address or the city near you or something and I’ll try to get rates.[/quote]Shouldn’t be more than $35 or so, that’s where i usually end up when purchasing stuff from ebay. Will PM now.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I’m currently look at the Samsung Captivate Glide.

Its the QWERTY phone I’ve seen I like the look of, but its US exclusive. Looks like it should work in Europe though. I’ve considered the Droid 3/4 but depends on price. I need to see how much I can sell an iPhone4S for as they’re a free upgrade option to me.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:167, topic:369953”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=466071.msg3906237#msg3906237 date=1328243190]

droid 4 is coming out soon, basically a droid razr with a physical keyboard - rumor is feb 9 release, here’s a review http://www.digitaltrends.com/mobile/motorola-droid-4-impressions-finally-a-4g-lte-phone-with-a-decent-keyboard/

I’ve seen the razr in person, and I wouldn’t remotely want that either, the screen is so friggin big it wouldn’t even fit in my pocket, damn…

I can pick up a Droid 3 from ebay for about 335 usd including shipping to Sweden, which is a pretty damn low price (borked ESN, aka won’t work on US providers, but fine on others). I probably will within the next 2-3 months or so, as i really want a physical keyboard over the turd that is touch-keyboard.

I can buy one locally for around $200-$250, but without solid cyanogenmod support I’m not sure.

@Swype, yes I have it, not as good as a physical keyboard.
[/quote]Oh wow, that sounds even better! Would it be possible for you to nab one for me? I can pay in advance over a bank transfer, including shipping of course![/quote]
I wouldn’t be against it, I just don’t know how much it would cost me to ship something from here to where you live, it’s possible it might not be worth it. PM me your address or the city near you or something and I’ll try to get rates.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:166, topic:369953”][quote author=cooper link=topic=466071.msg3905508#msg3905508 date=1328196863]
droid 4 is coming out soon, basically a droid razr with a physical keyboard - rumor is feb 9 release, here’s a review http://www.digitaltrends.com/mobile/motorola-droid-4-impressions-finally-a-4g-lte-phone-with-a-decent-keyboard/
[/quote]
I’ve seen the razr in person, and I wouldn’t remotely want that either, the screen is so friggin big it wouldn’t even fit in my pocket, damn…[/quote]
I’ve not seen it in person, but I know the feeling. The first time I held an epic 4g touch, I was shocked. I’m so used to my optimus’s 3.2’’ screen

I don’t know if I’ve said it before, but I think Motorola might be dropping something new for sprint sometime soon. Our in-store price for the photon dropped from $199 to $99 a week or two ago, and the XPRT dropped from $99 to $29.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

idk how to use swype. tried and it doesnt work handed the phone to someone else like seconds after i tried and it worked for them. I used to have to need a physical keyboard but having a large 4.5" screen and swiftkey x everything is fine. has 2 different styles precise and rapid. it also learns how you write so it will get faster the more you use it. you can type 160 chars in lets say 20-30 taps on the screen.

Read full topic

item.title: What cellphone do you own?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

too bad swype sucks for finnish as nobody writes dictionary language
